intro: Timonius creber, commonly known as the crested timonius, is a rare and lesser-known plant species belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, branched inflorescence that gives it its common name. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and the flowers are small and white, arranged in a complex, umbrella-like structure. Timonius creber is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited geographic distribution.
